content: copy­right vintage threads increase 2008 this is for personal use to not sell or barter items made from this pattern this pattern comes from the early 1940 s woolies for babies it has been brought up to date with changes by me in red supplies chadwick s red heart baby wool 1 ball 3/4 oz ie baby yarn wool fingering weight yarn steel crochet hook no 2/0 double zero steel hook 1 1/2 yards ribbon 3/4 inch wide organza or double sided satin 2 ribbon rosettes these you make yourself you can buy store made flowers or make your own easy to do on a flower loom gauge pattern stitch 3 shells make 2 inches pattern starting at center of back ch2 1st round 6 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook do not join rounds 2nd round 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 sts place marker here 3rd round *single_crochet in next st 2 single_crochet in next st an increase repeat from * around 18 sts 4th round *single_crochet in next 2sts 2 single_crochet in next st repeat from * around 24 sts continue thus increasing 6 sts on each round until there are 90 sts on the round and piece measures 4 1/4 inches from side to side across center this is 15 rounds now work 1 round without increasing slip_stitch in next st chain 1 turn and work back and forth as follows this helps to start curve of hat to transition to row going back and forth 1st row single_crochet in same place as slip_stitch * make crossed double_crochet s over the next 3 sts­ to make double_crochet s skip 2 sts double_crochet in back loop of next st ch3 holding last double_crochet and chain­3 down with left thumb make double_crochet in back loop of first st skipped single_crochet in st following crossed double_crochet s repeat from * until there are 18 crossed double_crochet s ending row with single_crochet in st following last crossed double_crochet 91 stitches over 73 stitches remaining single_crochet s are back of neck 2nd row chain 3 turn make 5 double_crochet a shell in each chain­3 across end row with double_crochet in last single_crochet chain 1 turn 92 stitches 3rd row single_crochet in double_crochet * make crossed double_crochet s over the next 3 sts single_crochet between shells repeat from * across ending with single_crochet in top st of turning chain ch3 turn repeat 2nd and 3rd row alternately until piece measures 4 1/2 inches from last round of single_crochet ending with the 2nd row if your gauge is correct should be 7 or 8 repeats because the repeats land between these two measurements so pick which ever you like do not fasten_off work single_crochet along lower edge and back of neck holding edge it to fit 1 single_crochet per round on front of cap and join two together on transition to back of cap the rest on the back is one stitch into one stitch about 9 inches fasten_off
